author: Staff Reporter
text:
Installing solar lights and LED bulbs had helped the Corporation to reduce its electricity consumption charges from Rs. 30 crore in 2014-15 to Rs. 28.81 crore in 2015-16.

The length of tar-topped corporation road is 758.85 k.m., 12.80 k.m. gravel road, 57.78 k.m. cement road and 19.20 k.m. mud road. Hence, the total length of the road is 848.63 k.m. that is maintained by the corporation. A total of 28,690 street lights are present in these roads in all the 60 wards.

Due to conversion of street lights into LED lights, the power consumption charges had reduced from Rs. 10.61 crore in 2014-15 to Rs. 6.62 crore in 2015-16, a release said.

The power consumption out of Nangavalli – Salem Old Water Supply Scheme that supplies 10 million litres per day (MLD) of water had also dropped from Rs. 4.26 crore to Rs. 4.08 crore when compared to 2014-15 and 2015-16.

However, with the Phase I of the Mettur – Salem Dedicated Water Supply Scheme becoming fully operational, the power consumption charges had also increased from Rs. 15.09 crore to Rs. 18.09 crore. Hence, the consumption charges had increased by around Rs. 2 crore in 2015-16 when compared to last year.
title: Corporation saves on electricity bill
